title: Introducing separate fonts from 50 Euros
content:
Submitted by [jfp](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/typophile.com/user/1275 "View user profile.") : 16.Mar.2009 8.13am 

[[http://www.typofonderie.com/profile/press/newsletter0309 | Newsletter March 2009]]

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fonts_en_50_4570.png)

For the first time, you can now buy [fonts separately](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/byfonts/) for a selection of families. From € 50.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lemondesansptf_sample1_6371.gif)

Le Monde Sans PTF, [fully revised,](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/gazette/hot_news/?id=303) with many new glyphs, Small caps for all weights, OpenType features. Enjoy right now the [pdf specimen.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/icono/alphabets/pdf/LeMondeSansPTF_pdf.pdf)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410im_/http:/typophile.com/files/costastd_launch2009_5494.jpg)

[Costa Std](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Costa)  
Not everybody need [full featured Costa Ptf.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/CostaPTF) After several requests, [Costa Std](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Costa) is now also available from € 140. Until the 16 April 2009, you can even save 20% and [buy it from € 112.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/special_offers/Costaoffer)

[Special offers](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/#specialoffers)  
 [Ambroise 3 packs: € 315](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/special_offers/Ambvaluepack)  
 [Le Monde 3 packs: € 315](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/special_offers/LeMondeSansJournalvaluepack)

[Vuitton Persona](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/VuittonPersona)  
Porchez Typofonderie [was asked to design](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/gazette/hot_news/?id=306) an all-capital two-color custom font for Louis Vuitton Malletier, a French luxury fashion and leather goods company

[Une certaine vision de l’histoire des caractères typographiques 2 (English version)](http://web.archive.org/web/20100204113410/http:/www.typofonderie.com/gazette/hot_news/?id=309)  
Featured here is the second part of a small history of type. This history, normally told from the Anglo-Saxon point of view, is from a French perspective, allowing the reader to form one’s own opinion. Part One, covering the origins to the twentieth century is also available.
author: jfp
